com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.subordinate.builder

Class ExpressionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.subordinate.builder.ExpressionBuilder

  • public final class ExpressionBuilder
extends Object
    The expression builder provides a convenient and more readable API for building conditions than using the various Expression/Operand classes.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis, Jonathan Austin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExpressionBuilder()
      Creates an ExpressionBuilder.

      Appends an equals test to the condition.

      • or

        public ExpressionBuilder or()
        Appends an OR expression to the RHS of the expression. The current RHS of the expression must be an Operand.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder.

      • and

        public ExpressionBuilder and()
        Appends an AND expression to the RHS of the expression. The current RHS of the expression must be an Operand.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder.

      • and

        public ExpressionBuilder and(ExpressionBuilder exp)
        Appends an AND expression to this expression.
        Parameters:
        exp - the builder containing the expression to AND with the current expression.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder.

      • or

        public ExpressionBuilder or(ExpressionBuilder exp)
        Appends an OR expression to the RHS of the expression.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder.

      • not

        public ExpressionBuilder not(ExpressionBuilder exp)
        Appends a NOT expression to this expression.
        Parameters:
        exp - the builder containing the expression to NOT with the current expression.
        Returns:
        this ExpressionBuilder.

      • build

        protected BooleanExpression build()
        Returns the built expression if it passes basic validation.
        Returns:
        the built expression, or null if the expression is invalid.

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Determines whether the current expression is syntactically correct.
        Returns:
        true if the current expression is valid, false if not.
